meanings.definition: At a standstill because of equal strength or opposition
meanings.sent1: The two teams were deadlocked in a tie, unable to break the even score.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations reached a deadlocked point, with neither side willing to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The chess game was deadlocked, each player refusing to make a move.
meanings.sent4: The courtroom was deadlocked, the jury unable to reach a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent5: The traffic was deadlocked, cars at a complete standstill in both directions.

meanings.definition: Unable to progress or move forward due to a stalemate
meanings.sent1: The project was deadlocked, as both teams had conflicting ideas on how to proceed.
meanings.sent2: The peace talks were deadlocked, neither side willing to give in to the other's demands.
meanings.sent3: The race was deadlocked, with two runners crossing the finish line at the exact same time.
meanings.sent4: The debate was deadlocked, each speaker presenting strong arguments with no clear winner.
meanings.sent5: The game was deadlocked, both players unable to make a winning move.
